website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight stroller that offers lots of storage.
pros: 4 storage options give more room than any other model
Dual canopies offer adequate sun protection
cons: Locking mechanism occasionally catches on the wheels

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take it to a Europe trip. Here is my review: Pros: 1. It is very light weight compare to other strollers I have seen 2. Durable and no issues in all the surfaces 3. Wheels are great 4. Easy to push and maneuver 5. Easy to fold 6. Includes cup holder which is a plus Cons: 1. After folding the lock is hard to push in and open 2. Using the feet to fold can be a little tricky
customer_reviews.author: Md A. Reza

customer_reviews.title: ... for our trip to WDW and we couldn't be happier. It's lightweight
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller for our trip to WDW and we couldn't be happier. It's lightweight, folds up tight for use on the resort transportation busses and it was comfortable for our two kids (4 and 2). The 5 point harness buckles worked well when the kids were napping and the canopy is generous to keep out the Florida sun. It was also great for the airports. Just fold it up and checked it at the gate. Storage is good in this stroller too. It has 4 total pockets that held everything we needed in the parks. Ponchos, extra jackets and sun hats. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lang

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the stroller! The only thing I don’t like is that I have to take off the cup holder in order to get through a doorway but other than that, it’s a lifesaver when I need to go out with both kids without my husband! The turn radius is great and it maneuvers very well. I like that each seat can recline independently and the shade is sufficient enough to cover their face and part of their body. Folds very easily and leaves great trunk space compared to other double strollers. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight double stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I had researched many strollers online before I bought this one. When my twins turned one, I knew they would want to ride side-by-side and also I was tired of lugging around my front/back double stroller (it's huge). This stroller is great - it folds up so small that we can store it in our coat closet, we can throw it into either of our cars easily (with plenty of space to spare) and it will great for an upcoming plane ride we have. Additionally, our 3.5 year old can sit in it too. I was worried about storage space since there is no basket underneath, but the mesh pockets have been working out fine!
customer_reviews.author: TexasinATL

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I bought it when it was listed ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I bought it when it was listed for $60..not sure why the price keeps changing. My kids fall asleep everyone we walk.
customer_reviews.author: Monique LaPlume

customer_reviews.title: So easy to push (even one handed) was worried my babies ...
customer_reviews.text: So easy to push (even one handed) was worried my babies would be to small (13 lbs /3 mths) nope reclines just enough , perfect straps nice and secured. Couldn't be happier with the price too.
customer_reviews.author: shuckhart

customer_reviews.title: In love with this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this stroller! We had a front/back stroller that was difficult to maneuver, but this stroller is super easy to move, fits through doors with ease, the seats are comfy and have the 5pt harness. I love that each seat has its own shade. If one kid wants it and the other doesn't there is no fight! The cup holder for parents has been a life saver! I completely recommend this stroller!
customer_reviews.author: courtney freeman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel - Not an Everyday Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great travel stroller. I would not recommend this stroller as an every day stroller but it works perfect as a travel stroller. We have a City Select twin stroller that we really love, but it is not easy to fold up. We were looking for something compact that we could take to the park, aquarium or on vacation. This fit the bill. It does squeak occasionally (like others have complained) and is not the most sturdy stroller (my kids love to lean forward in it), but again it is perfect for travel and really easy to collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Marina Girl

customer_reviews.title: AA approved
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few American Airlines approved weight double strollers. I bought this stroller for that exact reason. It handles surprisingly well. I honestly expected this stroller to not be as nice as it is at this price point. My almost 3 year old fits well enough for a short duration but it is excellent for 2 and under. The seats recline back a little which is an awesome feature I was not expecting in a double umbrella stroller. Excellent purchase at this price point especially if you travel.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: It’s a upgraded umbrella stroller for two. Here’s the pros and cons from using it. Pros -carries two comfortably. They really like the stroller and sitting next to each other. -The attachments(cup holder, pockets, under carriage, shade) -straps are very easy to adjust. Cons -squeaky wheels after 2weeks of use. (This bugs me ) -the handle bars are far apart -barely fits through a door. Can’t really help it since it’s a side by side design. -heavier than I thought
customer_reviews.author: KenGsaur

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones to enjoy the outting side by side
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews on this stroller and have to say it is build very well and so easy to assemble. I especially like having my grand babies side by side so they can share their experience while on the go. It folds easy and has the adjustable umbrella to block the sun. I just wish there was a tray for each child. I agree with most comments that some improvement needs to be done in reclining the seats and a tray for the parents to keep certain essentials handy. Overall it was a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Functional, briefly... wheels broke after a few months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this double stroller because we needed something that collapsed down to not take up too much space and it sort of worked in that capacity, but unfortunately the middle wheels have already broken after just 2-3 months of really using it. Pros: - Folds down well like umbrella strollers (some other double strollers take up like a whole room! folded!) - has room for both kids, not too tight a fit, which was a worry when getting something that folds down small Cons: - Brakes broke in about a month - The cheap latch to keep it folded never really worked - Plastic piece holding back middle wheels broke after 2-3 months of use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a double stroller for a long time. I wanted something not bulky and easy to fold with storage. This stroller has these things but... I used it once and the canopy that shades the children is completely bent and now doesn’t do what it’s suposed to and the wheel has the worlds loudest squeak to it. For $80 I would have liked it to last a little while but I definitely don’t see that happening.
customer_reviews.author: jessica Filippo

customer_reviews.title: It is incredibly easy to put up and down
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a gift when we found our we unexpectedly expecting another child. It is incredibly easy to put up and down. The ride is super smooth. I have no problem pushing it with one hand. I love that it is not huge, but there is plenty of space for the kiddos to sit as well as the small pockets for extra stuff like our phones, keys, etc, and drink holder. Our oldest who is going to be 5 can push it with ease as well. I also love the straps so I can use this when our baby is a bit smaller as we do not have a stroller that goes with the carseat.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect! It’s easy to fold, light weight, comfortable, fits both my children (3 months and 2 year old, material is easy to wipe down, not to wide, has small storage, cup holder, folds down pretty small, and perfect to keep in my car without worrying about having to take it in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Alexgumahester

customer_reviews.title: Great little stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great little stroller.. have had numerous expensive brands as I have 5 children, and I ordered this just for a few 5 k's I'm doing with my family and my 4 and 6 year old will get tired. I recommend this for babies who are already sitting up, not little infants! It doesn't go back and that would be a nightmare with a little one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, great price
customer_reviews.text: After days of researching for the most durable, easy to use and moderately priced double umbrella stroller we found the winner. We needed something to travel with that didn’t take up a lot of room like our other double stroller but was still comfy for the kids. This one folds up super small, is light weight but has gone on a couple trips and many walks. I love that the handles are high enough you don’t have to hunch over to push it and it has several pockets and pouches for personal items.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I bought this for my daughter who is too tall for doll strollers but still wants to play with dolls. This was only $16 more than I paid for her "Tall" doll stroller 2 years ago. The seats recline only somewhat, but so what? She like's to push her little brother around in this as well. Great cheap double stroller. Will keep in the future for when friends need something to borrow.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great for flying and Disney
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Disney World and it was super handy. Easy to fly with and folds up easy and compact. Also, this stroller moves smooth. As a mom of 5 I can tell you I have had MANY strollers from running strollers with the big wheels that you can't take anywhere to little umbrella strollers that the wheels always go sideways on you so they are pretty much useless. Not this stroller. Glad I found it. Wish I found it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Litchfield

customer_reviews.title: Handle bars too short for 5’9” person
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great stroller. Sturdy, well constructed, maneuvers well. Unfortunately it had to go back since the handle bars are too low. I’m 5’9” and the top of the bar measured 39”. Other strollers that are a comfortable height for me to push are 41”.
customer_reviews.author: SL22

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this double stroller for our twins. I have yet to find a door it doesn't fit through. This is our FOURTH double stroller. We started with the infant double stroller then got a jogger which wasnt practical for everyday use, so we decided to try a double umbrella stroller. We tried another brand originally and we returned it. We've been using this one for about 8 months and so far we love it. I do wish the visors to block the sun came down further, but other than that it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller, it fits in my car, both kids fit, I can walk my dog at the same time the only negative is the right front wheel seems to always like swivel and stop the stroller in the midst of the sidewalk, it’s not a huge deal now that I’m used to it, but a little tedious to deal with. Aside from that I would most likely buy another stroller like this in the future for the simple fact I can use it everywhere at anytime and it doesn’t take up the whole trunk of my sedan!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great double stroller for around town! I have a BOB which is a double jogging stroller, it’s great but so heavy and takes up a ton of space. This stroller is super light weight, and can fit under the feet of a backseat which i LOVE. You have to use two hands to maneuver it which takes some time getting used to as a twin mom I’m constantly trying to multi task.. (pull a cart and push a stoller etc...). Can’t beat the quality for this price!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: this stroller was easy to put up and down
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of it, this stroller was easy to put up and down. There is no under seat storage, but you give that up for a super light and compact double stroller. There is a but of a learning curve for the stearing, but again, when you get a feel for it, you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Checa

customer_reviews.title: We use this daily.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this thing out! We love it! I tried 3 of the larger double strollers. They were all too big for what I needed. When we got it my son was 2 and my daughters were 5 and the other about 7 months old. I could put any two of them in this stroller with no problems because of the straps. It also reclines enough for someone to nap. Light weight. Small enough to fit in the back of my car with plenty of room left for all the other stuff a Mama needs. Ha
customer_reviews.author: Leci

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this stroller for our upcoming family vacation but I have used it a couple times since and so far it is a great buy! I am kicking myself for buying all these expensive strollers in the past. This folds up fairly small, kids fit well.. I wish the kids had a tray or cup holders and I am used to shoving my diaper bag under the stroller but this doesn’t have a lot of storage space. But if you just bring the essentials you could fit them in the pockets behind the seats just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Annastasia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: Excellent travel stroller. We purchased this stroller for our first flight with our 1.5 year old twins. It was light enough to gate check and get in and out of the car without issue, but still sturdy enough to walk around Boston for multiple days. We also used it on public transportation without trouble (subway). I would recommend it to anyone looking for a double stroller to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Janna Mason

customer_reviews.title: Super light and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my friend and I can take our girls (7 and 12months) for walks and on trips without needing to bring two bulky strollers. This is the best purchase I have made. The girls love it. They really enjoy being next to eachother. It folds up nice and tight, making it great for storage and saving space. Only downside is minimal storage. It has two small bags to put things in. But no place to store bags, toys and blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Janie23

customer_reviews.title: Great compact stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love the pockets on this umbrella stroller. The recline is so nice, great for our girls(2 1/2 years old and 6 months old) to take a nap in. I'm 5'5" and I don't hunch over to push it. My husband whose 6'1" says it doesn't bother him all that much.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: One of the lightest twin strollers
customer_reviews.text: This twin stroller is smal. My babies will outgrow it quickly but it is worth having it in your car as it is compact and easy to open and close. This stroller survived overseas flights, broken sidewalks and going on a cabin lift. Turning is not smooth, there is no storage and the materials are cheap. But it is light and does wear out my back. The height is better than several similar strollers. It does not recline as other reviewers mentioned. And my twins learned quickly to wiggle out of the top straps. Basically using three point straps only. But did I mention it is light!
customer_reviews.author: vih

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and easy to maneuver through doors and sidewalks
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is a lifesaver. Very lightweight and easy to maneuver through doors and sidewalks. The only downside is that the handles are low. Isn't there a way to make a stroller with adjustable handles? My back would love it.
customer_reviews.author: hicyn

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but the wheels lock up ( update review)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for (grandmas house) so we don’t have to pack our double stroller I love this is compact easy storage the only reason it’s not a 5 it’s the wheels the middle wheels have been locking to the point you have to tilt the stroller to get it going again. Do NOT buy! Definitely a waste of money I bought it looked aside the fact the wheels would lock up thinking it would fix it self. It doesn’t definitely returning this, really upset because I was happy at first thinking this would work I definitely gave it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Yeardley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 5 mo old and toddler.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. We used this for our 5 month old and 2.5 year old. Love the recline, the canopy size is perfect, and it folds down perfectly! Our 5 month old is a little on the small side but holds her head up well. The 5pt harness made it very safe, even though it isn't recommended for babies. We love this stroller! So much easier to manage than the graco double stroller or joggers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina N.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great stroller. It's light weight and easy to steer ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller. It's light weight and easy to steer and fold up. My only complaint is that I wish it had a clip up at the chest area because my kids just get their arms right out of those shoulder straps with no problem at all. Also, I wish the stroller was just a tad taller. I am pretty tall, 5'10" and I could stand the stroller to be maybe an inch or two taller and my husband is 6'2" and he hunches over when he pushes it. Other than those small complaints, this is a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly at all
customer_reviews.text: Worse stroller I have ever used! So difficult to adjust the straps. I tried for weeks. When I thought I had it , it was still twisted up. My child almost fell out because I cannot adjust it to make it any smaller all because of a major twist that was there since it arrived. My babies can sit and stand on their own and definitely not user error. I spent hours on this. I gave up and am finally returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use quality double stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make my day easier at Disneyland and it did not disappoint. Perfect amount of storage, convenient cup holder, easy to maneuver, and light weight. My 5 year old and 8 month old both fit into nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Samwolfe

customer_reviews.title: No coverage!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the idea of this stroller... however, when we put our 1 year old twins in it, found that the canopies did not cover them at all! What's the point?!?!? Ended up returning it...
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Q. Mance

customer_reviews.title: So glad we purchased this
customer_reviews.text: We love that this stroller works for both of our kids, but doesn’t take much room to store. It’s light weight and easy to move. It also folds up easily. So glad we purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller. I was online searching for used double strollers but then saw this one that was the same price (and even cheaper) than the used ones I was seeing! I immediately ordered it and I am so happy I did. It's easy to fold, easy to store, and easy to maneuver. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great double stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has been just great for my 4 year old and 6 month old. They both fit perfectly and seem comfortable. It's very easy to fold up and take places. It has some difficulty if you push on uneven surfaces, but that's normal for a pop-up stroller.
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: The handles are VERY comfortable. Goes well with a universal rain sheild and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for domestic travel and will be using it for international travel as well! Folds up compact and fits perfectly in a "Red Gate Check Bag". Works well on urban streets (Chicago in light snow and wind) and handles very well. The handles are VERY comfortable. Goes well with a universal rain sheild and JJ Cole Urban Bundle Me.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena

customer_reviews.title: I took my 2 year old and 6 month old out to the mall and 6 month old fell asleep comfortably in the stroller even with minimal recline
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with this stroller. I wanted a double stroller that is lightweight and has recline options and this one has it all. I wish seats were little longer so my kids’ legs can be supported little more but short seats are typical for umbrella strollers so I get it. I took my 2 year old and 6 month old out to the mall and 6 month old fell asleep comfortably in the stroller even with minimal recline. Easy to fold too. I like it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall people or if you want sun of off your kids faces
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller for the price. I love the burgundy color. My twins are qq months and they seem to like the stroller. The biggest downfall is that the handles are just simply to low for me, I am 5’11’’ and either have to hunch or have my husband push it. He is 5’5” and says it feels great for him. Second con is definitely the size of the shades, too short. Easy to put tugether though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it!! Small, compact & light!! Such a smooth ride!! Has lots of storage! Love the fact that the back of the seat are adjustable!! Considering umbrella strollers are not!! My almost 3 yr old & 18 month old love it!! I am 5'4" & it's just my size!! I couldn't have found a better stroller!!
customer_reviews.author: good

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stroller for the price! We got it for our 3 & 15 month old for our Disney trip and it was everything we hoped for. Really easy to navigate, fits through doors, super lightweight, & folds up easily. Wish there was a little more storage space & wish the seats reclined more but other than that it was perfect for what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Axel and wheel had huge play like a bushing was missing
customer_reviews.text: Had a floppy wheel , Axel and wheel had huge play like a bushing was missing. Repaired with nylon bushing / tube to take up that slop. Ok after that. Adjusting is utiltarian and not easy. The lower latch release, to fold it back up, will pinch your fingers if not careful... Can't be done with foot.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Nice double stroller.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a 2.5 year old and a 5 month old and it works great, but it is a little small for the 2.5 year old and that is the only reason for the 4 stars. But it does keep the older one strapped in or else he would be running with the wind and he is fast.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for my 7 1/2 month old twins
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant in purchasing this stroller since my twins are only 7 1/2 weeks old and Since the previous reviews I read state that it doesn't recline enough but it's perfect! It reclines enough for my twins who can hold their heads up for only short periods of time so it's perfect. It's compact, lightweight and easy to assemble with one hand. I definitely recommend for a parent on the go.
customer_reviews.author: cat gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Breaks broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. The breaks on this stroller are tiny flimsy plastic pegs that broke off in less than10 uses. They’re so dinky it wasn’t initially obvious that’s what was happening but it became clear fast. I didn’t see this issue in earlier reviews so this may be a new thing but it renders the stroller truly a waste of money. You can’t safely use a stroller that doesn’t have a breaking mechanism. Total dud. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Srini J

customer_reviews.title: Not huge at all
customer_reviews.text: Very small and compact. And as a mother of two sets of twins this is definitely the smallest double sided stroller I have ever seen. The others I’ve purchased were so oversized and I just wanted one small enough so when I go out for walks it’s easier for me to carry to my car and out. Very happy 😃
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Have been using this for a month and we love it. Kids are comfy and enjoy riding in ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a month and we love it. Kids are comfy and enjoy riding in it. It has done well on most unpaved surfaces like grass and packed dirt. Have not gone on gravel with it yet. Super easy to push and takes up less room than my single jogger. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has been PRICELESS to our family! We have had it 2+ years and would gladly pay extra to continue using it. We travel often, so this lightweight stroller is perfect for airports. It has been through dirt roads in Mexico, cobblestone roads in Madrid and just about every type of terrain without any issues. My kids are 5 and 3, way too heavy for this stroller, but we still use it for zoo trips and the like. My kids also have slept several naps in it, even if the seats do not recline. I would recommend this stroller to anyone with two toddlers. It was made my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, had to return
customer_reviews.text: I planned this to be a replacement of a 10+ years cosco juvenile but had to return, seats are very small, arm stripes cannot adjust to little kids and overall feels very basic. Old stroller is way more sturdy, had to return.
customer_reviews.author: FERNANDO RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: The wheels and shoulder straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an extra stroller and I love my other one so much more. For the price I would say it is an ok stroller, my other stroller costs alot more so that might be why the other one is so much better. The wheels on this one suck. They dont roll that well on areas where there may be twigs and grass ( a park for example). The shoulder straps dont hold my twins in place, they can easily move forward and are constantly try to get out of this stroller. It does have convenient storage and is easy to open and close the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: KD24

customer_reviews.title: wheels don't work
customer_reviews.text: The rubber part of the wheel fell off the first time I used it. It only drives properly on sidewalks, useless indoors, gravel, uneven concrete... my cheap one was much better, what a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Humble

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this stroller. I have only had it for less than 2 months and it is already broken. The center back wheel just broke and we’ve used it maybe 5 times. My husband had a Jeep, my boys have a power wheels Jeep and we’ve used the Jeep diaper bag. Needless to say, I trusted the brand but they definitely let me down on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Once my twins (16mo) outgrew their infant seats, and thus the Snap n Go, I was having to lug out my huge double jogger for every outing, and it was killing me! I saw another twin mom with this one and ordered it immediately. It’s so easy to set up, store, and break down, and the canopy is more generous than many umbrellas I’ve seen. The wheels are definitely best for smooth surfaces (indoors, well-maintained roads, sidewalks); they feel a bit flimsy on rougher terrain, but hey, it is an umbrella stroller after all. We’ve been using it for a couple of months, and are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Atkins

customer_reviews.title: No lying position, not for tall parents.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Stroller for people of short stature, I have to bend down because the handles are not adjustable. 2. Children can easily lean forward even fully strapped as the back is not fixed and soft. 3. The middle wheel always gets under your feet when walking 4. There is no prone position 5. Soft wheels are the main plus 6. The front wheels constantly cross the road on rough terrain I don't recommend for tall people. The purchase is short-term and now I am looking for a replacement urgently, as this is an inconvenient and impractical thing.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to fold and set up
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this stroller! Definitely great to just leave in the car, fairly compact. We have a Buick Enclave and with third row up doesn’t leave much trunk space so this stroller is perfect! One down side is there is not much lean - but 2 year old fell asleep in. Also have a 4 month old who sat perfect- we did add headrest to her seat for more support.. Great buy for the cost
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for two kiddos
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried larger double strollers like the Joovy, and I preferred this one because it’s much more compact and lightweight. I have a 3 year old and a 1.5 year old, and this is a perfect stroller for kids with a small age gap because they have fun sitting next to eachother on walks. Biggest negative is the cup holder placement, it attaches to the side of the stroller, which then makes it too wide and hard to get thru doors.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best stroller I have used, and I have four children. Very easy to load and unload, fold and unfold. The straps can contain a very young infant, around 3 months+. It does have two expandable pockets on the back of each seat. We can fit bottles of water and mabye a small coat or two. Fits very well through doors. Highly recommended stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha T

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Very great buy! Looks just like the picture. The only downside is the lack of storage but I have a diaper backpack so it didn't bother me. Kids were comfortable in them too. It's light and easy to open/close. Smooth ride as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandchildren, per my daughter's request. The children - age 18 months and 4 - enjoy riding together and it is easy to maneuver with one rider or two. Good product and affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: RCSK

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for a double stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome umbrella stroller. I don’t have any problem storing it and folding it when I go out and about. Works better for younger babies as I can see how taller toddlers might dangle their legs out to the ground. If your baby is under 2 years old, you can’t beat this price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: KNG

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller! You pay for what you get
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this stroller specifically for traveling and Disneyland! This stroller met all of our expectations, we were shocked. The 2 pockets in the back make enough room for your daily essentials and must needs for the kids. The stroller had a couple problems with turning but overall was an amazing stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Freimarck

customer_reviews.title: Barely any recline!
customer_reviews.text: Not a good umbrella stroller! The “multiple position recline” is one adjustable strap that only allows the seat to go back a few inches. Then the back if the seat rests against a hard metal bar that hits the babies midway on their backs. Recline is so minimal that I barely see the difference between recline and full upright position. Not a comfortable stroller for napping. Then the sunshade is another disappointment. Again so minimal that it doesn’t really provide any sunblockage unless sun is directly overhead. Disappointing purchase for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Sondi

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller! Light
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller! Light, spacy ( have 2 yo and 4 mon old) and compact at the same time. Seats lean back enough for 4 mon old to sleep comfortably. Nice price too for this stroller category. Would like to have a table for kids but it's just me being spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Vladislav Valentinov

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight double stroller. Bought for traveling and for trips to the store (not for our outside, long walks). Lots of storage for things and really easy to assemble. Looks bice as well. Durable and good shocks. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Angie F

customer_reviews.title: This is PERFECT for all of the above reasons
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light weight stroller for my growing twins. I was actually hesitant to give up my city mini in exchange for an umbrella stroller but I needed a smaller stroller to fit in my car and not break my back getting it in and out. This is PERFECT for all of the above reasons. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angella Fallin

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this little stroller. If you are hesitant, don’t be! It’s a sturdy little thing for being an umbrella stroller. Turns great and folds well. Very space efficient and it has pockets on the back which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Nicole Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller for the price! Like many others we bought it for Disney. It turns easily. Ny 6 year old barely fits but she fits. She is a normal weight and height for a 6 year old. For the price you can not beat this! The extra storage available is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. The package was delivered and was pretty torn up and beat up. But nothing inside was ruined or even touched. Super easy to put together and is not too big. Fits perfectly through my front door. Very easy to maneuver. I would definitely recommend this to a friend. I bought this for a vacation we have coming up and cannot wait to use it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessblaze2288

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact and great for travel
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. One of the few double strollers you can take down the jetway when traveling. New guidelines state stroller must be under 20 pounds on the airline we travel on most. This is our go to stroller now for everyday use. Folds up small in the trunk too.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th stroller and I think it will be my last. The wheels just pop on out of the box. It’s very light, folds just as small as a regular umbrella stroller, and fits through doorways. My 2 and 1 year old are comfortable in it & it’s convenient to bring along with us places. Such a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy, easy to fold. But NOT reclinable and not washable.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy, good size seems to fit anywhere. A little heavy but easy to fold (need both hands). My only complaints would be that the “reclinable seats” can only recline like 2 inches so I don’t really consider that “reclinable” and it is not washable, cannot take off to put in the washer like most strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for travel or quick running around it folds nice and its light weight. It has two mesh baskets on the back to hold things, it has retractable seats. It rides and pushes smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S Gese

customer_reviews.title: Good on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I love the easy fold of this stroller! It’s durable for family walks and enough storage for toys and snacks on the go. The only con is one cup holder. I would not recommend for jogging! My kids are 3 years and 1 year old. This comfortable for my kids too.
customer_reviews.author: Mills

customer_reviews.title: Easy double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Easy double stroller. Pretty sturdy while maintaining a light weight. We've had ours a year and it still looks new despite tons of use. My only complaint is that to wash it, I just have to spray it down. If it comes apart for washing, I haven't figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Holli Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It handled our trip very well. We had it checked at the gate and were using it daily for 7 days without anything breaking. Its sturdy and handled rough terrains well. The only thing is its a bit narrow for my 2 yo but he's on the big side.
customer_reviews.author: Hiba

customer_reviews.title: Happy buyer
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. Lacks the quality that the summer lite umbrella stroller has but that is only a single stroller. Happy to have a double umbrella. Fits through doors. Holds my 6 year old and my 1 year old.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Best double stroller I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my vacation and it worked great. The kids really enjoyed using it and they both slept in just fine. I love all the extra pockets. It was very simple to fold up. We were a group of people and would have to fold it every time we got on the bus and everyone who had to fold it figured it out very quickly and easily. I think it’s even better then the original double stroller I got because it is so easy to move and get around in.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 days of use with my little twins, the plastic footrest broke. Basically rendering the stroller useless during our Disney vacation. I would not purchase this product and look for a better made stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Cuchna

customer_reviews.title: easy to fold
customer_reviews.text: easy to fold, and holds the kids nicely. love that it has a 5 pt harness. if your ordering this it is not JEEP brand, it is DELTA! no idea why they put J is for jeep as the brand. crappy part is that the cup holder will not fit through door ways so make sure you take it off before going through any door
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! My 2 1/2 year old and 8 month old love riding in this. It's very easy to push and really does fit through doorways. Enough storage space for our family. This is an awesome buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for twins!
customer_reviews.text: I have twins and this was a great upgrade from their carrier stroller. It is lightweight, easily maneuverable and very compact. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Very light, compact, works well!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it, other than there's no storage below the seats. The cupholders are pretty cheap/weak. We lost the one that came with it while checking it on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our girls
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our girls, our 19 month and 9 month old love riding in this. It's easy to fold down and open, the little extra fabric on the canopy comes in handy on those extra sunny days. I really like that this came with the 5 point harness instead of a 3 point, all in all it serves its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Not the best when it comes to maneuverability.
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with maneuvering all of the time, it’s a nightmare! Material has torn in a few places, just not a very durable product in my opinion but it has done the job for us. It just really doesn’t have the best maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel!
customer_reviews.text: We used it for several flights with our twins and it was great. (Delta and America; 2/2020) Easy to fold, get them in/out and wipe down. We unclipped the shoulder straps and kept the lap straps so we could feed them pureed food between flights (and when we were in the hotel!). Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: I’ve really liked this stroller so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve really liked this stroller so far. I bought it for my 5 month old twins. It’s been easy to close and store and easy to open with one hand (and feet to lock them in place. Steers well and I love the cup holder attachment. For the money, it’s a great stroller so far.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Aston

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome stroller. Its very lightweight, super easy to lift by one hand and hardly takes any space when folded. Its easy to stow and maneuverability is good too.
customer_reviews.author: ToThePoint

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: Will work perfectly for our needs. We wanted something less then $100 that would hold both our toddlers on outings and maybe a small bag or two. This fit the bill perfectly. It shipped and arrived earlier then expected and is great. I recommend for anyone needing a cheap double stroller for general outtings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael curry

customer_reviews.title: Small seats
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to fold up which is what i was looking for, but the seats are very very small. My 9mo old is a tight fit there's no extra room for him to move and look around at all. My 2 yr olds head sits right under the sun shade and his feet are close to dragging on the ground (he is 35in). Also the seat belts shoulder straps fit really weird.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is PERFECT! After looking at MANY reviews from many different strollers blah blah blah- this is perfect in every way!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill massengale

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this stroller for my newborn and 2.5 year old. I absolutely love it, it rides nice and the seats recline. My baby can sit in it with out slumping over. It folds compactly and fits into the trunk of my car with plenty of room left. I drive a Hyundai Sonata. I highly recommend. It’s inexpensive and nice! I REad tons of reviews on all different strollers. Hope this helps you
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Bilbrey

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight double stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! We use it often! My only complaint is it is sometimes hard to steer, almost like one wheel doesn't want to turn completely with the others. It's easily resolved but can be a big frustrating. I am 5'1" and can push this easily. My hubby is 6' and complains that the handles are too short. It is nice and light and fits easily into the back of my Corolla!
customer_reviews.author: Ashliegh E.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. So easy to set up, easy to push around and fold and unfold. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Seat does not recline
customer_reviews.text: This strollers seat does not recline. So if you have a small infant or sleeping child you will not want this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: B & D

customer_reviews.title: Stroller time
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller! I have a three and a one year old, no issues. I just wish the cup holder was better otherwise it’s great to move around everywhere and it conveniently fits through all doors.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to steer and gets through doorways without an issue ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to steer and gets through doorways without an issue (just have to make sure neither child is extending their arms to the side). No under storage but comes with two storage bags behind the backrest. Can fold with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy adventures

product_meta.title: Jeep Scout Double Stroller, Lunar Burgundy
product_meta.description: Color:Lunar BurgundyEpic family adventures are easy with the J is for Jeep Brand Scout Double Stroller from Delta Children. The stroller is finished with exclusive accents, including an extendable European-style canopy, reclining seat with multiple positions and reflective piping to help you and your children stand out from the crowd. Awesome 5.5-inch wheels with front swivel and suspension allow you to effortlessly discover everything that's out there. Lightweight and capable of explorations near or far-the J is for Jeep Brand Scout Double Stroller is outfitted with abundance of storage options, so you can get your children and all their gear where they need go. Each seat holds up to 35 lbs.
feature_bullets: Extendable canopies with sun visors; 5 point safety harness with soft shoulder pads and reflective material that ensures you and your children can be seen at night; Meets Disney size requirements
Multi position reclining seat Parent cup holder
Abundant storage includes double rear canopy bags 5.5 Inches wheels with front swivel and suspension system

Lightweight design that fits through standard 30 Inches wide doors Assembled Dimensions: 23.4 Inches D x 29.9 Inches W x 37 Inches H Folded dimensions: 13 Inches X 11.2 Inches x 42.1 Inches; Product weight: 18.30 pounds; JPMA certified; meets or exceeds and ASTM and applicable CPSC standards
Designed for a child between birth and 3 years

specifications.Style: J is for Jeep Brand Scout Double Stroller, Lunar Burgundy
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars859 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
